Hello Johan and Arjun, thanks so much for the comments. @Johan: Most of the Singapore flats already have bulletin boards placed near the lift, however we don't see much interactions going on there. The group took that into account and decided that a dedicated task board might be something key in encouraging interactions. @Arjan: We all identified that the lift is a great area of opportunity. However, there were thoughts that maybe such a high-tech solution in a public lift might not be so feasible due to risks such as theft. We welcome all comments helping us to redefine this further!

I came across this neighbourly doorknob hanger idea by Candy Chang while exploring the web: http://candychang.com/neighbor-doorknob-hanger/It's like one of those do-not-disturb signs, except it lists out ways a neighbour can help or requires help, so that passers-by (neighbours, of course) can assist if possible. I suppose that's what your idea is about, and this is just a little add-on for added inspiration :D
I love the lift idea!! That's when we all have a little bit of time to spare and will read any notes posted.

If the existing bulletin boards are under-utilized, then perhaps there is potential to do like a whiteboard-surface inside the lift, that tells little "clues" about what is happening on the big bulletin board in the lobby, so that people will be curious and take an extra minute or two to go to the bulletin board instead of rushing away to work :) (you could even write messages in the lifts in next door buildings, about the "big announcement" on the bulletin board in your house, so that people will do a detour just because they want to check it out)   just my 5 cents!

Fab stuff, Tan! Would be great if you might update your post and answer the fields at the bottom of the Concepting form to help gear your idea to our challenge focus. (You can update your post by hitting the Update Entry button up there on the right) Looking forward to seeing more of you on conversations across our challenge.

Thanks Meena for the reminder. In fact, I had quite a bit of technical problems posting this up too. After my 3rd attempt I managed to post it up. Do also help us to refine this concept further! Welcoming every possible comment here!

Sorry to hear this Tan. Sometimes copying and pasting from an existing document can raise issues  we suggest copying into a program to unformat text first (if you're using a Mac, there's Text Edit) then copying from there. Great to see the conversation you've triggered via your post!

I love the Kampung idea of this concept. My father used to tell me about the tradition of his native region, where villages (or Kampungs) would also have bonds with other villages, the 'Pela'. This bond was about helping each other out, in some forms it even became a family bond. It would happen that villagers from a predominantly muslim village would help their 'Pela' village to build a church and vice versa. Loved it.

singapore_hdb_living_kampung_style.title: Singapore HDB Living - Kampung Style

web_platform_for_community_projects_volu.description:
Imagine a Sunday cleaning of Serangoon Road, Singapore or any Community Park or any public space with the help of local corporations and neighbours and friends - & there's free beer and lunch. 

Concepts by Kris Nair  / Amy Chong /  Paul van Zoggel
web_platform_for_community_projects_volu.creator: daeb08c6ee58d827c32489413577b703

comments.text: I WISH OpenIDEO had a 'Edit Button' for virtual teams - so easy for all of us to edit and refine the idea/concepts.
Could be a good one to add to our Feature Suggestions section on our forums, Kris: http://bit.ly/oi_forums

HI Kris, just a thought on your Ambassador element: perhaps communities working on similar projects can join forces to get more people out to complete the job better and faster. Both parties can win together.
Yes - we need to gamify governance - any thoughts?

Leaderboards can be an option to increase interaction and participation. Communities can gain points every time they complete and activity, and if they team up, then they both get double the points because of "synergy" created together.

We need leaderboards for 1. Top Volunteers2. Top financial contributers3. Top ideas (in OpenIDEO format?)4. Top Brand donors5. _____?Also - the dashboard should show 'top problems to solve' in each locality and then beam it to the city then state then country?
Top Impact? (define and then track Measures of Success)Top collaboration? (involving multiple people, agencies etc)
YES - Top Impact is a must / and a list of best-practices

Top 'franchise'? I can imagine if locals have a great community action and method to get people involved easy. This concept should be easy to 'plugin' another neighborhood/block. Than what works spreads fast beyond the individual enthousiast. For the creative designers under us, this is an incentive to work out great 'actionpacks' inside your action options list.
Top community involvement (percentage of people in community). It would be amazing to see a community to have close to 100% involvement for an event.
Top Awareness. We want to spread the word on these initiatives to inspire others. If you/your community gets the event in the newspaper on on TV, then you take the lead.
Paul : Top franchise is a good idea to build accountability and group work - but governance of the committee would be a trouble as it might goto the typical 'power struggle' things.
Amy: Top Community is a good way to improve involvement of communities

Kris on Franchise : I look at it naturally; survival of the best and this should be rewarded. Somebody with a great idea and is able to design a SMART http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SMART_criteria solution/action in co-creation, will be motivated to do so if it is not likely to be a one time event. That the seeds of the tree can spread, so energy input is not exceeding the possible output. Than the ecosystem starts to work in my opinion.
Paul! Thanks for the SMART link . Is it ok if I add you to this virtual team? Need your brain in making the idea 'inclusive+co'
of course is ok. Your concepts sees the ecosystem needed, now to find the rules of nature so people and actions can grow!
Congrats on this post being today's onsite Featured Concept!
Thank you!
We need an 'EDIT' button for collaborating with Virtual Team! Say, My team-member Amy wants to edit some & add some to the concept

Fantastic concept. Do you think there might be synergies worth exploring with this other concept - http://www.openideo.com/open/connected/concepting/community-input-suggestion-website-with-voting-most-popular-ideas-put-forward-to-gov-t-business/ ?

Great detailed approach Kris, seems you know a lot. Just to let you know, I just posted a concept on "waking up streets" before offering options to do something. http://www.openideo.com/open/connected/concepting/ring-10-doorbells-with-1-question-streetbarometer-singaporeOut off experience this helps moving beyond a hype with a few people doing something once. With more people/ages involved. And connect social experts/government/local needs. I see I way forways for Singapore to do grassroots "street temperature" inquery by/for locals, and after it emediatelly jump in your programme.

Hey Paul! Thanks for the kind words. 1. 10DorrBells : I love the idea of primary feedback collection. It would be a good tool for the local-governance agancy to findout the burning problems of the area and craft policies accordingly!I have posted a mobile based solution to data-collection here (http://www.openideo.com/open/connected/inspiration/mobile-text-based-citizen-feedback-system-for-communities-cities/) But your idea is better and more human - Let's team up and refine it better?
Excellent idea. I just might share this idea with some of my city council members.
Thanks Leticia!
Congrats on being a Featured Concept! Love the potential for scalability of web/digital platforms. Inspired me to consider different ways we could motivate and empower people to help out.
I loved the 15Minutes/Day -
Let's team up and make the concept better?

Lots of exciting thoughts here, Kris. You might like to check out Brickstarter to see if there are learnings there which might help in the development of your idea : http://www.springwise.com/non-profit_social_cause/finland-crowdfunding-platform-community-projects/  Looking forward to others chiming in here & watching this idea grow! Anyone got ideas on a name for the initiative?
Also wondering about the free beer part... possibly might put of folks who want to join in with their kids and be an issue for government and some kinds of corporate sponsorship?
Meena: Yep - by free beer I meant some 'pull' - Ice cream for kids maybe? :)
and yes - I'll check Brickstarter

web_platform_for_community_projects_volu.title: {SG:niter} Web-platform  for Community Development Projects (Volunteer & Fund) #UPDATED

weare.sg.description: WeAre.sg (or We Are Singapore) is an active online community to share stories on improving the Singapore environment, but also to inspire and generate ideas on how to make Singapore even better.
weare.sg.creator: 6fed0e6f1ba44f0520bc14fceee3663d

comments.text: Arjan - we're so sorry that we may have lost some of the updates to this concept over the last 72 hours - we lost the AWS server stack which included the backup and even after working through the night some updates escaped us.  We've extended the Refinement Phase to the 27th to give everyone extra time to re-upload their content and to push your concept even further - apologies again if you did lose any updates...

I can imagine this concept in any or a combination of all of these potential formats:1. written text as a blog. (or as direct email to subscribers)2. videos, as video-blog or vlog.3. audio, podcasts as mp3 or streaming.4.  other media ?
Love this idea!  Similar to what we do on OpenIDEO, engaging "community reporters" to inspire and collect ideas would increase the number of options/solutions!
Thanks Hao! And it's indeed a little bit like OpenIDEO :).

Hello Arjan Cool, a space for linking positive ideas. I wonder if this platform could also "report" on events such as http://www.openideo.com/open/connected/concepting/dish-in-dish-out-potluck-for-a-cause/. People can find out about potluck events in their area, report on new ideas, share success stories and build even more positive experiences. Perhaps it might also report on hawker centre flash mobs? The idea I have is to shift from someone-will-do-it, to I-will-do-it. So it would be great if the flash mob could be reported on to spread the idea that anyone can create their own flash mob for change. There might be tool kits  http://www.openideo.com/open/connected/concepting/tool-library-for-every-district/. It can tie in with James idea which is for the actual hard resources that people may need. This site might provide the ideas, blueprints and know-how to accompany the tool library. Some way to hook these up would be cool. Ideas and resources. What do you think?
Loving the notion that the platform be used for sharing resources as well as stories, Christine. Great build!

Dear Christine, thanks for your comments! And yes, of course the reporters can report on events like the potluck and the flash mobs. The intention is, that they have an assignment to find and report on things, events, ideas that are contributing to the benefit of the Singapore society, and can be turned into great project to improve neighbourhoods and keep them clean. These reports can be made about what is already happening in Singapore, but also outside of Singapore. I think it's a great idea to create some sort of wiki/tool library section as well, so that people can easily create their own events and change.

Arjan, congrats! Your idea is in the NEA Challenge Shortlist. We loved that your idea relies on citizens to start and sustain it. Looking to refinement, how might you involve more citizens in contributing, and what natural behaviors might you leverage to get people engaged with the site?  For more tips on how to iterate and prototype your idea during the Refinement phase, read here http://bit.ly/connect-refinetips and check this Lowdown: http://bit.ly/oi_refine
Hurray! Thanks!

I like your idea, Arjan, and congratulations on being shortlisted! We might be able to encourage diverse segments of the population to contribute to the projects, as well as the content creation. This is a great example of how students, working as a class or on an individual basis, can positively influence their environments, and then share their experiences with others. Although the reporters (4-6) have the ability to detect patterns, encourage participation and inspire certain behavior, we should think about encouraging some user-generated content creation (self-expression is a strong motivator). For an online platform to work well, it is vital to generate lots of online content that can be easily shared, as well as a community. Hope you find something here useful!

Kirk, indeed useful comments. As I said in the concept, it's inspired by the Quality Hunters project. What I found there was that because of the activity of the community management team, a lot of community members were active in creating content. By commenting, discussing on twitter and posting as well on their own blogs. The 'carrot' for that was a place as the 8th Quality Hunter. So maybe something like that would be a good one: award 2 reporter places for the next cyle to the most active members.

Hi Arjan, like the sentiment behind this, and think it will strike a chord with Singaporeans. There is already at least one citizen reporter site that I know of, called Stomp: http://www.stomp.com.sg .. this is very popular, however, it is also quite gossipy and 'catty'. I am not sure whether you would consider building this existing audience (with an appetite for user generated content) or building new brand. If partnering with Stomp, some kind of categorization would have to weed out the happy stompers with good community news from the gossips/complainers. Perhaps your WeAreSG site would offer a fresher more positive brand. Just some food for thought! You could maybe then use the existing active stomp audience to select each new group of 4-6 community reporters? Possibly this would be just the critical mass you would need to get enough participation to get off the ground.

Thanks James, that would be a good idea to look for leveraging the stomp audience. Maybe there could be a special section, aimed at co-creation and reporting. This concept is more about finding great initiatives, reporting on them and using them as inspiration for more improvement projects. Especially the last bit makes it slightly different from Stomp, I think. But I'd definitely look for ways to collaborate with them.

Great! You could perhaps recruit the community reporters in a sort of relay? handing over the baton after a set time period?Sweden have got one official twitter account, with the name @Sweden, and there is one citizen elected each week, to do all the tweeting, in the name of all swedish citizens, to the world.The person that is the current "reporter" will be able to nominate one of their friend, for the following week, or choose any of the good tweeters that are around. Also the "jury" are always interested in getting recommendations from anyone that wish to notify about the best active tweeters.This will work as a carrot for writers to continue to be active. As soon as any of them takes a hiatus or just stops writing long and interesting, it can lead to all activities coming to a halt. (Like a blogger that just writes for one month and then stops entirely.)I guess you will need to start somewhere, to get the ball rolling, perhaps with freelance journalists, media people that already are writing about their city and current affairs.

Fab idea, Arjan  and I support Johan's notion of having revolving community reporters  to create aspiration to become one, to enhance the diversity of perspectives brought to the initiative and to further leverage network effects.

Thanks, Johan and Meena! And @Johan: indeed, the @Sweden twitter account was definitely in my mind. I tried to describe a continuous effort in the concept,  but I guess it wasn't clear. The idea is that every 2 months a new group starts as citizen reporters. Maybe 1 should be chosen by the public, one nominated by the current group and one selected by the organisers. Something like that. But definitely not just a 2 month project, but a sort of relay indeed. I'll try to adjust the text a bit.

weare.sg.title: WeAre.sg

py/tuple: How easy would it be for citizens to get involved and take initiative for this idea?
Very easy; this would rely on ground-up participation from the beginning.
Somewhat easy; there are ways for citizens to get involved, but an outside organiser may be needed to sustain and grow this concept.
This concept needs to be led and maintained by the government or private business.
Can you build this concept on top of something that already exists, like an organisation, physical space, or system?
Yes. This could fold into, or extend from, something that already exists.
This concept taps existing networks for a few things, but also needs a lot of new processes, materials, relationships, etc.
This concept requires a new system to be built to support it.
After the initial launch and support, could this concept be sustained and cared for over time by the community it's designed to serve?
Absolutely! This concept is easy to keep going.
It depends. There are opportunities for growth, but it's not yet clear how the concept would thrive after launch.
Probably not. A lot of effort would be needed to keep this concept going.
Does this concept create community?
Yes. It naturally brings people together and inspires them to take care of one another.
There is potential to create a thriving community.
No. It doesn't galvanize people to come together for a common cause or interest.
Overall, how do you feel about this concept?
It rocked my world.
I liked it but preferred others.
It didn't get me overly excited.

beforeafter_social_change_platform.description: Before&After is a social platform that allows people to share their before-and-after photos and stories to inspire and empower others to change their environment, make better use of their resources and act for change.
beforeafter_social_change_platform.creator: 0aab8ed8e94e13d9acfd932ff356f623

comments.text: This it a perfect idea. It can be combined with appropriate music and we can make the Positive alternative of Harlem Shake - the positive change.
I like the idea to take it step further.Nice, that you read the old posts as well!

Into it! Unique and straightforward approach to storytelling. I haven't seen anything like this yet, and as an evangelist for the power of the great internet, I'm excited at the prospect of seeing happen.
Congrats on this post being today's onsite Featured Concept!
great!
Brilliant brainstorming K + Yaris! And your business model thinking is fab too. Am totally digging the simplicity of this which could be easily translate across media channels as you suggest.
Thank you Meena, I hope others will have some nice ideas to add to this concept too!

This idea really stands out to me because it is so simple and easy to understand. Posting before pictures is a great way to connect people who are interested in tackling the challenge together. It brings people together with a purpose. To add on to the idea one could also have monthly make-a-thon events where teams can "compete" in creating  before&after creations.

Good idea Shelagh. Those events might be also a place for people to show others how to repair/reuse/redesign things.Competing itself is also an interesting idea, maybe there might be some sort of competition on the website, like FB "likes" or OpenIdeo "applaud" and the most popular posts would be shown on homepage.

I love this idea. An image tells a lot in a very short amount of time.  This method is often used in architecture and urban planning to get immediate attention and to trigger ideas.Friends often share ideas of how certain things can be improved. They comment and criticize, but often fail to propose.We might think how everyone can compose their 'after' pictures to spread their ideas. Not everyone has the skills to make this possible, but as you mentioned, others can jump in and help. A quick and fun way is to print the 'before' picture and sketch on top of it. Maybe a simple drawing tool can be offered to sketch directly on the website or app.I have used this method a lot, it is very powerful, and it has great potential to be used for a broad range of purposes. Good job!

thanks Wout. Nice idea with printing the "before" picture. Maybe not only to sketch but also as a motivating inspiration. I think there might be some easy ad-on to the platform that helps users work on their images. On the other hand Instagram and other existing applications can help as well.

creative_space_christchurch_nz.description: Gap Filler aims to temporarily activate vacant sites within Christchurch with creative projects for community benefit, to make for a more interesting, dynamic and vibrant city.
creative_space_christchurch_nz.creator: fc0f76e102a8dedc09ced82bde274b5f

comments.text: Congrats on this post being today's onsite Featured Inspiration!

Interesting! One of the things I like about Gap Filler is temporariness of their projects. There are so many places in todays cities (not only the ones that faced some kind of a disaster) that for years stay empty because their owners wait for building permissions etc. This gives people a chance to use those places and the owner knows that they'll vacant it the moment he needs it.

I completely agree! Check this out http://emptyspaces.culturemap.org.au/I like the idea of looking at voids in a city as white canvas. If we start seeing it that way, will it encourage people to fill them instead of avoiding them? Is it possible to change our view of the empty space?

nice! I like what they write to landlords that have an empty property or land. Except obvious social and cultural benefits for the local community, it can also raise the property value, save it from vandalism. Everyone can benefit.
Gota love those savvy New Zealanders! ;^)

Nice questioning about communities uniting around a common cause! It's interesting how some community needs are universal, and yet many are also very place-specific. Any Singaporeans out there want to weigh in?

floating_barges.description: Repair & Customize Old unused barges to move around recycling centres, evening schools and allotment gardens between all the residential areas, on the rivers and around the shorelines of Singapore. (rotating schedule)
floating_barges.creator: 656863f55543ea22d1dbce290f237277

comments.text: updated, please comment here if you got additional ideas! :D

A few another angles to the idea... what if the barge(s) became a museum, interactive demonstration project or an institute dedicated to rejuvenating the local environment? (Retiring and repurposing an oil barge is symbolic, and it can potentially alleviate real estate costs) I'm learning to appreciate how you think about safety (fences for dog parks). :)

community_dog_parks.description: Community dog parks help promote positive community environments including improved resident connections with neighbors and a stronger sense of community. This helps lead to a growing desire to work together for the greater good of the community.
community_dog_parks.creator: dfd725a56b61cff68679d9f573c784d8

comments.text: As a dog owner, I like this concept. I've lived in several places (and countries), and there's a thing I found to be true everywhere: walking your dog, means meeting other people, especially those who walk their dogs. I can't count the many nice conversations I had, and even some friendships, with people who's name I did not really know, but I always knew the name and age of their dogs. I think it has to do with the fact that the dogs just want to sniff each other, and so you have to stop, and that creates a natural environment for chatting. In dog parks, when dogs are off the leash and playing, there are always conversations going on.So dog parks are a great idea, but also other spaces where you can create similar situations that lead to people with a connection (in this case dogs) have time for a chat.
Exactly the same is true for children and parents

I wonder, what if you could get dog owners to bring their used and broken lightbulbs, PET-bottles, metal tin cans, batteries etc to the dog park. And placed at that site are recycling containers with instructional signs and plenty of reading material, brochures that they can take home to place in the kitchen cabinetsIf there is very little free space at the site, you could have collection of only one material type per week, and rotate the containers often, so it doesn't litter the area.These ideas just came because I thought about the fact that dog owners usually go frequently to same place. combine two healthy and socially responsible errands at the same time!
Great build Johan!

I completely agree with Johan in combining several sustainable efforts as a key to designing this dog park.  I was also thinking of adding things such as compost bins.  More importantly, as a dog owner in NYC, I know how unpleasant it is to see bags of waste just sitting in trash cans around the streets.  I read a news report not too long ago about The Park Spark project which takes dog waste and converts it into energy for park itself!  Please check out the link.  http://parksparkproject.com/home.html

I thought about compost, but had the impression that dog poo was not so good to put in compost, isn't it required to dig it down below ground for it to be useful as "replenish" the soil? and then you need to solve the issue of the plastic bags that dog owners scoop up the poop with? maybe produce special compostable dog poo bags? site-specific for this project?

I didn't so much mean using the poo for the compost, just compost bins in general to add to your ideas of recycling.  I actually learned that pet waste does not make quality fertilizer.  With that being said, the park spark project does incorporate special bio-degradable poop bags for pet owners to use.  Once disposed, the methane that is produced powers all of the lights in the park.

Hi Claire, interesting post! Any chance you could find an image to go along with it? Images help grab attention and tell a story with higher impact. You should be able to use the 'Update entry' button on the right of your post and follow the instructions to add images from there. We know occasionally people have issues uploading images so let us know by hitting the Support tab on the left hand side of most pages of our site if you face any problems. Looking forward to seeing more of your inspiring ideas on OpenIDEO.

Couldn't resist to offer some help here. If you're looking for dog run pics, here's a few of my dog in one: http://baroninbaltics.posterous.com/another-nice-afternoon-at-the-sunu-pastaigasAlso, there's the inspiration of Jenine with a great video: http://www.openideo.com/open/connected/inspiration/talk-to-the-dogs-creating-community-from-the-ground-up/
Added a picture!

crazy_coupons.description: Discount coupons, "frequent shopper deals" and temporary offers. The concept is to tie together customers choices with local business owners that are doing better social and ecologically responsibly business choices.
crazy_coupons.creator: 656863f55543ea22d1dbce290f237277

comments.text: Do you have any experience from Groupon? comment, please? www.groupon.com

another add-on could be the recycling of PET bottles or Metal Tin cans or old batteries, i.e. deliver 2 of them to a shop for recycling, and you get some cents for one of them, and some cents for the other goes to the shop owner, for their planned project. See some more info on an old inspiration that I wrote for an earlier challenge: http://www.openideo.com/open/localfood/concepting/recycle-2014-donate/
